text: Maria Elisabeth Geyser (born November 6, 1912 in Münster / Westphalia, died June 26, 2008) was a German judge. After 1945, she was first deputy at the Provident Office Munich, 1955 was a secondment to the Federal Social Court as a researcher. After Dr. Maria Schwarz, she was the second woman, who held the positions of a judge or chair judge at the Federal Social Court. ==References== Category:1912 births Category:2008 deaths Category:German women judges Category:20th-century German judges Category:20th-century women judges
title: Maria Elisabeth Geyser
